greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n-step n-dimensional nonnegative lattice walks starting at the origin and using steps that increment all components or decrement one component by 1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..50
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, b(n-1, map(x-> x+1, l))+add(
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = If[n == 0, 1, b[n - 1, l + 1] + Sum[If[l[[i]] > 0, b[n - 1, Sort[ReplacePart[l, i -> l[[i]] - 1]]], 0], {i, 1, Length[l]}]];
a /@ Range[0, 23] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 29 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 26 2021
